intro: Aethusa cynapium var. elatior, commonly known as the greater cowparsnip, is a biennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and celery, and is characterized by its large, umbrella-like flower heads. The plant has a tall, hollow stem with finely divided leaves that resemble those of its relatives. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that develop into spherical, dry fruits containing numerous seeds. This variant is often found in moist meadows and along riverbanks, where it thrives in temperate climates.
